title.native: 恋は雨上がりのように
title.romaji: Koi wa Ameagari no You ni

description:
Akira Tachibana was once the ace of a track club, but an injury forced her to quell her passion for sports. Masami Kondou, a divorced father, had ambitions of being a writer and now manages a restaurant, where Akira works. It is the intersection of Akira and Masami’s seemingly disconnected lives that makes each of them reconsider and redefine everything about themselves.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)
synonyms: Love is Like after the Rain
เส้นทางชีวิต ลิขิตหัวใจ

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Restaurant
tags.description: Features a business that prepares and serves food and drinks to customers. Also encompasses cafes and bistros.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Athletics
tags.description: Centers around sporting events that involve competitive running, jumping, throwing, or walking.

tags.name: Writing
tags.description: Centers around the profession of writing books or novels.

tags.name: Classic Literature
tags.description: Discusses or adapts a work of classic world literature.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

title.native: 恋は雨上がりのように

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ameagarinoyouni) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mayuzuki_jun/)

Mayuzuki Jun is a Japanese manga author and artist. Long aspiring to draw manga for a living, she never became a full-time employee anywhere before becoming a professional manga artist. Her 2007 oneshot debut, Sayonara Daisy, won third place in Shueisha's first Golden Tiara Award and was later included in [an anthology under the same name](https://anilist.co/manga/110288/Sayonara-Daisy/). Her first serialization, [Iromon!](https://anilist.co/manga/134243/Iromon/), ran briefly in Shogakukan's Monthly Big Comic Spirits from 2013 to 2014. 

Mayuzuki is best known for creating [Koi wa Ameagari no You ni](https://anilist.co/manga/86639/Koi-wa-Ameagari-no-You-ni/), which received both [anime](https://anilist.co/anime/98385/Koi-wa-Ameagari-no-You-ni/) and live-action film adaptations. The series won the 63rd Shogakukan Manga Award in the general category and was nominated for the 9th Manga Taisho Award. Since 2019, she has been working on [Kowloon Generic Romance](https://anilist.co/manga/112544/Kowloon-Generic-Romance/). The work again received nominations, for the 14th Manga Taisho Award as well as the 2020 Tsugi Manga Award (Print Category).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B8%A1%E8%BE%BA%E6%AD%A9)

Ayumu Watanabe is a director, screenwriter, storyboard artist and a former animator.

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/265623665) | [Website](https://atelierub.jimdofree.com/)

Married to [Ryouji Masuyama](https://anilist.co/staff/100952/).

[Website](http://www.aimer-web.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimer_and_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aimer_0907_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCR1zT1s524Hbc85bdvno_8w)

A Japanese pop singer and lyricist signed to SME Records and managed by FOURseam. Her name comes from the verb "aimer" in French which means "to love." She is known for being a faceless voice. She very rarely appears on her music videos and most of her live performances are dimly lit to obscure her face. She finally revealed herself on the August 20, 2016 episode of Music Station.

Her father was the bassist of a band, so Aimer grew up surrounded by music from a very young age. She began studying the piano in elementary school and highly looked up to Ringo Sheena and Utada Hikaru. In junior high school, listening to Avril Lavigne inspired her to take up guitar and began writing English lyrics. At the age of 15, Aimer lost her voice due to over-usage of her vocal cords and was forced to undergo silence therapy for treatment. However, that did not stop her, and after she recovered, she acquired her distinctive husky voice.

Aimer teamed up with the "Agehasprings" group, which has worked with, produced, or provided music for various artists, including Yuki, Mika Nakashima, Flumpool, Superfly, Yuzu, and Genki Rockets. In 2011, her musical career began in earnest. In May 2011, they released the concept album "Your Favorite Things." It covered numerous popular works, including works in various genre such as jazz and country western music.

Married [Masahiro Tobinai](https://anilist.co/staff/146979/Masahiro-Tobinai) in 2023.

__Website | Twitter__ Birth: CHiCO's year of birth and any further information of her early life is currently unknown or not publicly revealed. Her birth was privately held, and only shown to be on a January 27. Biography: CHiCO is a female japanese singer that is currently under the label: MusicRay'n Inc. While growing up CHiCO was very interested in anison (a term used to abbreviate Anime song, but is also used generally when referring to anime music that has a focus on opening and ending theme songs). Upon entering high school she was introduced to a voice training teacher by an acquaintance she knew at the time, this pushed her to become a professional singer. In the summer of 2013, CHiCO entered the national singer audition "Utakatsu!" (specializing in "Anison" and "Vocaloid") hosted by Sony Music Entertainment SD Group. She won the grand prize at the contest, which led to a decision to collaborate with the creator group "[HoneyWorks](https://anilist.co/staff/146863/HoneyWorks)". On the 6th of August, 2014, CHiCO debuted with the opening theme song for the anime "Ao Haru Ride" named "Sekai wa Koi Ni Ochiteiru" under the guise of "CHiCO with HoneyWorks". This was her official debut as a singer. On the 18th of November, 2015, CHiCO together with HoneyWorks released their first album named "Sekai Ha i Ni Michiteiru". This was CHiCO's first ever album release, and the album sold 24,000 copies during its first week of sale.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mitanikokuti2)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yasunoriebina)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉原俊一郎)

Affiliated with studio Bihou.

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/144195464)

__[Website](http://honeyworks.jp/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/honeyworks828/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/HoneyWorks_828) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/HoneyWorks56410) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/59387)__ __Biography__ HoneyWorks, alternatively known as Haniwa, is a Japanese circle consisting mainly of the composers [Gom](https://anilist.co/staff/147280/Gom) and [shito](https://anilist.co/staff/147276/Shito), and the illustrator [Yamako](https://anilist.co/staff/119761/Yamako). The guitarist [Oji](https://anilist.co/staff/148135) (Kaizoku Ou), the illustrators Rocoru (in 2013) and [Mogelatte](https://anilist.co/staff/121589/Mogelatte), the video producer Ziro and the pianist [cake](https://anilist.co/staff/147555) (the latter three joining in May 2014) are also part of the group as support members. Later on they acquired the drummer Nakanishi in 2017. However, Rocoru graduated from the group in 2019. Some of their most popular songs include "Suki Kirai", "Hatsukoi no Ehon" and "Kokuhaku Yokou Renshuu". Their music style consists mostly of positive rocky songs. In January 2014 they had their first major debut, with the album "Zutto Maekara Suki Deshita.", which ranked in fourth place on Oricon. In May 2014, the start-up of "CHiCO with HoneyWorks" was announced. Sometime in early 2019, the circle began to include subunits: s×c, a duo comprised of shito and cake; and HoneyMonster, comprised of Gom (Kouto), cake, and Nakanishi. The circle also created a number of fictional idols, such as LIP×LIP and Dolce. In addition, ten light novels, based on the Confession Executive Committee Love Series songs "Kokuhaku Yokou Renshuu", "Yakimochi no Kotae", "Hatsukoi no Ehon", "Ima ni Suki Naru.", "Koi-Iro ni Sake", "Kinyoubi no Ohayou", "Heart no Shuchou", "Ijiwaru na Deai", "Boku ga Namae wo Yobu Hi", and "Daikirai na Hazu Datta." have been released so far. A short novella about the song "Watashi, Idol Sengen" was also included with a CHiCO with Honeyworks album. Light novels for HoneyWorks' other songs do exist as well; the Love and Hate Trilogy ("Nakimushi Kareshi", "Suki-Kirai", "Hajimari no Sayonara") and "Sekai wa Koi ni Ochiteiru" and its sequel "Koi no Chord" both received one.

__[Website](http://honeyworks.jp/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/honeyworks828/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/HoneyWorks_828) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/HoneyWorks56410) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/59387)__ __Biography__ HoneyWorks, alternatively known as Haniwa, is a Japanese circle consisting mainly of the composers [Gom](https://anilist.co/staff/147280/Gom) and [shito](https://anilist.co/staff/147276/Shito), and the illustrator [Yamako](https://anilist.co/staff/119761/Yamako). A Japanese pop singer and lyricist signed to SME Records and managed by FOURseam. Her name comes from the verb "aimer" in French which means "to love." She is known for being a faceless voice. She very rarely appears on her music videos and most of her live performances are dimly lit to obscure her face. She finally revealed herself on the August 20, 2016 episode of Music Station.

It covered numerous popular works, including works in various genre such as jazz and country western music.

Married [Masahiro Tobinai](https://anilist.co/staff/146979/Masahiro-Tobinai) in 2023.

[Profile (agehasprings)](http://www.ageha.net/archives/ageha_creator/tamai_kenji)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tamaken0906)

Kenji Tamai is a Japanese producer, sound producer, vocal contractor, composer, arranger, lyricist and he is also the Representative Director of the sound production team agehasprings.

__[Profile (agehasprings)](http://www.ageha.net/archives/ageha_creator/tobinai_masahiro)__ __Tobinai Masahiro__ is a Japanese composer, arranger, remixer, drummer, keyboardist, guitarist and sound producer working for Agehasprings. Married [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/Aimer-) in 2023.

__[Profile (agehasprings)](http://www.ageha.net/archives/ageha_creator/tobinai_masahiro)__ __Tobinai Masahiro__ is a Japanese composer, arranger, remixer, drummer, keyboardist, guitarist and sound producer working for Agehasprings. Married [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/Aimer-) in 2023.
Married to [Takayuki Hirao](https://anilist.co/staff/102247/).
